p: The experimental area of the study was carried out in São Sebastião do Paraíso, south of Minas Gerais, in the southeast of Brazil ( Fig. 1). Historically, the region is the most important coffee area in Brazil, and one of the most important coffee producers worldwide. The average altitude is 950 meters, and the average temperature and rainfall are adequate to high quality Arabica coffee ( Coltri et al., 2015). The experimental area had four coffee plantation systems: three in shaded systems, and one in full sun (the control). The shading was considered “in row”, as demonstrate in Fig. 2. Fig. 2a and b present the study area in a Geoeye-1 satellite image (having 1.84 meters of spatial resolution), and Fig. 2c and d show the scheme of the study area as an input data to Envi-met model.
